intro: Panicularia elongata, commonly known as the slender panicled grass, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale green to yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, which are branched, loose inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its botanical characteristics make it a common subject in ecological and botanical studies.
